All functions

bd_analyze_soln()

Analyze the result of a call to bd_do_inference

Assess the equifinality or time spans in the input radiocarbon calibration curve

bd_calc_calib_curve_equif_dates()

Calculate equifinal dates for each point in the calibration curve

bd_calc_calib_curve_frac_modern()

Calculation the calibration curve fraction modern for input calendar dates

bd_calc_gauss_mix_pdf()

Caculate the density of a possibly truncated Gaussian mixture

bd_calc_gauss_mix_pdf_mat()

Calculate the dnesity of a possibly truncated Gaussian mixture for a matrix of samples

bd_calc_half_life_from_peak()

For each sample, calculate the time it takes for the density to decrease by half from the peak

bd_calc_meas_matrix()

Calculate the measurement matrix given N observations and G grid points

bd_calc_quantiles()

Calculate the quantiles for an input matrix X

bd_calc_relative_density() bd_calc_relative_density()

For each sample, calculate the time it takes for the density to decrease by half from the peak

bd_convert_gauss_mix_param_list_to_vect()

Convert a Gaussian mixture parameterization from a list to a vector

bd_convert_gauss_mix_param_vect_to_list()

Convert a Gaussian mixture parameterization from a vector to a list

bd_do_inference()

Do Demographic Bayesian Inference This is the core function that implements the Bayesian inference. The input is a problem statement object (a list), prob, that consists of the input data (the vectors phi_m and sig_m) and the hyperparameters (hp). stan is called via the rstan package to sample from the posterior. The output is the variable soln of class bayDem_soln, which is a list with the fields prob (the input) and fit (the result of the stan fit). prob can also have an optional field control that specifies the following control parameters for the Bayesian inference (default in parentheses): numChains -- (4) Number of chains sampsPerChain -- (2000) Number of samples per chain initList -- The initializations for each chain. The default is to sample from prior using hyperparameters adaptDelta -- (.99) The value of the adapt_delta parameter, an input to stan. The stan default is 0.8, but a higher value is sensible for a mixture model with more than a few parameters, hence use 0.99 by default

bd_draw_rc_meas_using_date()

Simulate a radiocabron measurement from input calendar dates

bd_extract_param()

Extract the Bayesian samples for a Gaussian mixture model generated by bd_do_inference

bd_load_calib_curve()

Load Calibration Curve

bd_norm_pdf_mat()

Normalize the rows of an input density matrix

bd_phi2y()

Find calendar date from fraction modern value given known bounding indices

bd_sample_trunc_exp()

Sample from a truncated exponential distribution

bd_summarize_trunc_gauss_mix_sample()

Identify growth periods and the peak value for a truncated Gaussian mixture

bd_vis_calib_curve()

Visualize the calibration curve with equifinal and non-equifinal time spans
